CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 14, 1964, pg. 4 reads: "Launch "New Weapon" - James Jordon, newly appointed president of Pittsburgh's "new weapon," the Business and Job Development Corp., which launched this city's effort to aid the economic strength of the areas in which Negroes are the predominant residents, confers with Mayor Joseph Barr and Ex-Governor David Lawrence, currently chairman of the President's Committee on Equal Job Opportunities, on the new project. The aim is to create job opportunities and expand small businesses. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: James Jordon in center speaking to Mayor Joseph Barr and former Pennsylvania Governor David L. Lawrence at head banquet table with podium and WAMO microphone in interior
CatSubject_tab: Lawrence, David Leo, 1889-1966.Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Microphone--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Radio broadcasters--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.WAMO (Pittsburgh, Pa).Interiors--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Tables--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Barr, Joseph M., 1906ï¿½1982.Jordon, James.
